comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Its due to this reason,  The Fed will raise rates in the week ahead, but what Chair Powell says may matter most.QuoteThe Federal Reserve’s two-day meeting is the highlight of the week ahead, and the next catalyst for markets will be what clues it gives about future rate hikes.The Fed is widely expected to raise the fed funds rate by a half point Wednesday and again next month, but Friday’s very hot consumer inflation report sparked expectations policymakers could hike faster and higher.Markets are fearful of a recession, so stock investors are watching the bond market, which is sending fresh signals that the economy could be weakening.So there's a lot of uncertainty right now, recession the war in EU, and then the Feds raising the rate. So this is bad news for every financial market not just bitcoin. Although it just magnify today with a huge 13% decreased already. And it's seems scary, but as I have said, we can't do anything to stop at it is inevitable. So just remain calm, we're all in it, and don't sell your cheap bitcoins to the whales.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: The reason why Bitcoin had a horrible week is mostly due to 2 reasons.First one was the horrible CPI numbers. Means there is going to be more aggressive fed rate hikes and it’s bad for stocks and bad for crypto.Second is the insolvency of Celcius. They paused  withdraws and keep adding collateral to prevent them from being liquidated. Right now they liquidation price is like $17K. comments.author: BobK71
comments.body: Crypto is a market of uncertainty. When btc went from 64K to 38K, many people thought that it might be the end of the bear market. But when the market goes down further, it is thought that 30K will probably be the lowest price btc. But yesterday we saw 15% dumping, no prediction were correct. Now investors are worried and waiting to see when the market will return to its normal behavior.

comments.author: onecall123
comments.body: Why wouldn't it be $22k if everyone wanted it at $70k? Funny how things work out. Keep that in mind. You don't make wealth in bull markets. Wealth is made in bear markets. A buy always follows a sell. Inflation at record levels suggests otherwise. The millennial generation has never experienced high inflation and what happens with assets. The price of cryptocurrency should not fluctuate due to inflation. This is the concept behind it.Inflation has nothing to do with it. As they tighten monetary policy and increase interest rates, the markets become less liquid.

Apart from that, the specific reason yesterday has to do with what in Spanish is called corralito:'Corralito (Spanish pronunciation: [koraˈlito]) was the informal name for the economic measures taken in Argentina at the end of 2001 by Minister of Economy Domingo Cavallo in order to stop a bank run which implicated a limit of cash withdrawals of 250 ARS per week (at that time 1 USD = 1 ARS). Electronic transfers and credit and debit card payments were not disrupted.'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CorralitoCelsius, Binance and Bitfinex paused or suspended withdrawals which triggered panic and led to the thought of a terra luna-like event. When these things happen, short positions get liquidated, and also people get scared and sell out.Now it seems to have stopped a bit as there is a strong resistance around 20,000 USD.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: RecessionInterest rates by Papa Powell Tech Stocks fallingUS Stock market going into a bear market and we know that US Stock market and crypto are somewhat correlatedGlobal InflationRussia-Ukraine WarGive some if there is some events that I missed out aside from those I said above. I think these are the reasons why Bitcoin is going down. Well, let's just don't focus on the reasons but let's focus on the things that we should do in order for us to not panic or not have any losses. Don't panic, be patient and accumulate. These three things will help you survive whatever is happening right now. It is easy to say but TBH, newbie investors are having a hard time doing this for some reasons. Don't worry because overtime, you will learn from experience and you will know what to do if this will happen again in the future (which it will).
